newsitem.title: LEBANON: Mixed trade on Beirut Stock Exchange.
newsitem.headline: Mixed trade on Beirut Stock Exchange.

text.p: Shares were mixed in higher turnover on the Beirut Stock Exchange on Wednesday.
The LIBX bank index rose 0.63 percent to 190.4, the LISPI general index rose 0.19 percent to 96.32 while the BLOM general index rose 0.61 percent to 1110.71.
BSE turnover rose to 232,148 shares from 198,484 shares a day earlier for a value of $1,989,985 against $2,977,640.
The turnover included a bloc of 100,000 Eternit shares traded on the board at $2. Another 8,000 shares of the pipemaker firm traded at $1.875 from $1.9062 a day earlier.
Solidere shares were mixed. Solidere B shares rose to $13.25 from $13 while A shares held steady at $12.875.
Demand for the shares was heavy.

The company's global depositary receipts traded at $17.3 on the London Stock Exchange on Wednesday. Brokers expect Solidere shares, which they say are the most undervalued stocks in Beirut, eventually to get stronger.
Banque Audi fell to $27.125 from $27.25. Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce rose to $20.5 from $20.25 while BOB shares rose to $5.625 from $5.5625.
There was no trade in the other listed industrial firms -- Ciments Blancs and and Uniceramic.
